intro: Hoffmannseggella × jacintoana, commonly known as the hybrid jacinto, is a natural hybrid between Hoffmannseggella lutea and Hoffmannseggella jacintiflora. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. It is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Due to its hybrid nature, it exhibits a wide range of morphological variations.
